result.execSummary:
The defendant Eric S Berg was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: any probation now serving.

miscConds.notes: Costs paid in full from bonds on file.   If the defendant is placed on probation or released to extended supervision, IT IS ORDERED that the defendant pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
Obtain and maintain employment, commensurate with his treatment needs.  Not to terminate his employment without his agent's prior approval.

If agent recommends, defendant must attend and successfully complete an alcohol assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant is to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

Defendant to be subject to random testing by his agent.

If agent recommends, defendant must attend and successfully complete a drug assessment, and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

Defendant to be subject to random testing by his agent.

Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.

Defendant shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, or by any other means with C.H.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.

Attend and successfully complete domestic violence programming, if agent recommends.

Court advised defendant of the DNA submission requirement.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: A civil judgment is granted for unpaid court ordered financial obligations.

May serve in Eau Claire County.  Huber allowed, according to jail rules.
Consecutive to: Jackson County Case No. 14CM235.

DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody, with Attorney Poss.  15CM6, victim notification complied with.  14CM235 no victim.  Parties have the revocation packet.  No corrections or changes noted.  State 14CM235, Count 2. 6 months jail.  15CM6.  Counts 2 and 3.  90 days, count 2, 5-7 months Count 3 concurrent to each other, but consesecutive to 14CM235.  .  Defense:  143 days credit on 14CM235.  128 days credit on 15CM6.  14CM235 - 9 months.  15CM6 - 60 days on Count 2, 7 months Count 3.  All concurrent.  Serve in Eau Claire County.  Huber.  

Court ordered:  14CM235.  6 months jail.  15CM6, 60 days jail on Count 2, 5 months jail on Count 3. Each count concurrent, but consecutive to 14CM235.   May serve in Eau Claire County with huber, according to jail rules.  Judgment for unpaid court ordered financial obligations.  $1,899.45.  $154.35.  143 days credit on 14CM235.  128 days credit on 15CM6.
with revocation summary attached.  Sent to Judge electronically.  JMM
from DOC
Sentencing hearing on revocation on March 14, 2017 at 04:00 pm.
DNA submission form

ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody, with Attorney Poss.  Defendant plead no contest to count 2 in 14CM235.  Also to Counts 2 and 3 in 15CM6.  Count 3 in 14CM235 dismissed by operation of law. Dismiss, but read in the remaining counts in those cases, and 14CM151,16CM102,15CM84 and 15CM35.  Victim notification complied with.  Court recited the charges and possible penalties on the counts he plead to.  Priors confirmed by the court with the defendant.    Defendant understood.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant.  Defense stipulated that there is a factual basis for the pleas.   Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily, and intelligently entered her pleas and waived her constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the pleas.  Found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, contrary to 947.01(1), misd. bail jumping, contrary to 946.49(10(a) and OWI 2nd with passenger <16.  346.63(1)(a).  Joint recommendation for:  14CM235.-  probation 15 days jail.  fine alc assmt and dsp.  15CM6.  2 years probation concurrent.  no alc.  AODA and rec. treatment.  DV programming if agent recommends.  Other recommendations of agent.  Attorney Poss says defendant has 35 days credit on 14CM235.  

Court ordered:  sentence withheld, 2 years probation. Concurrent with 14CM235.  The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.    Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  AODA and reco. trt.  Subject to random testing by agent.    Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.  CC, DV programming if agent deems it necessary.  No contact with C. H.  Obtain and maintain employmnet, commensurate with treatment needs.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 17, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody, with Attorney Poss. Set all cases for a plea hearing.

ADDRESS INFO for Eric S Berg
Current: 428 Platt Street, Eau Claire, WI 54703 United States  (Effective: 04-29-2015)
Prior: W12182 E Town House Road, Alma Center, WI 54611 United States

This bond covers 15CM6 & 14CM235:  Until further order of the court, you shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, except through your attorney, with any of the following individuals: with victim Catherine H.; nor her residence or place of employment.  Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  As a condition of your release, you must be available 24 hours per day, 7 days a week to submit to testing for alcohol when requested by a law enforcement officer or your probation agent. The defendant may submit to an alcohol test at the Jackson County Sheriff's Office or submit to a PBT by a law enforcement officer. Upon request, the defendant shall appear for and submit to testing within two (2) hours of the official's request.  Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle on the highways until properly reinstated in the State of Wisconsin. Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion. Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle on the highways until properly reinstated in the State of Wisconsin.

Clerked by JM:  Defendant appeared by video from Jackson County Jail with counsel SPD Paul Fredrickson present in the courtroom.  Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defendant had no explanation as to why he didn't appear at last hearing.  Initial appearance done on 15CM6 & 15CM84 - waived reading of complaints, stood mute.  Court entered not guilty pleas and set pretrial and status dates.  Cash bond set with conditions on those 2 cases.  14CT35, 14CM151, & 14CM235 all set for status the same date as the 2015 cases.
